techmeme.title: Coinbase agrees to acquire Dubai-based Deribit, the world's biggest trading platform for bitcoin and ether options, for ~$2.9B, including $700M in cash (Lauren Thomas/Wall Street Journal)
Q&A with Bill Gates on closing the Gates Foundation on December 31, 2045, donating ~$200B, President Trump, Elon Musk, AI drug discovery, AI advances, and more (David Wallace-Wells/New York Times)
Palworld developer Pocketpair says a 2024 update was due to "ongoing litigation" and a new update is "yet another compromise", as it disputes Nintendo's claims (Victoria Kennedy/Eurogamer.net)
Match says it will cut 13% of its staff, impacting ~325 jobs, per a 2024 filing, and reports Q1 revenue down 3% YoY to $831M, above est., and 14.2M paying users (Natalie Lung/Bloomberg)
SMIC reports Q1 revenue up 28.4% YoY to $2.2B, vs. $2.3B est., profit up 161.9% YoY to $188M, vs. $222.4M est., and says H2 has "opportunities and challenges" (Reuters)
